alert.note: Alert for Coffee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 16 at 12:56PM CDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern Coffee County through 130 PM CDT... At 1256 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Brundidge to 7 miles northwest of New Brockton to Elba. Movement was east at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elba, Fort Rucker, New Brockton, Mixons Crossroads, Curtis, Carl Folsom A/p, Lowry Mill, Camp Humming Hills, Clintonville, Wise Mill, Roeton, Camp Alaflo Bsa, Clowers Crossroads, Arcus, Woodland Grove Church, Jack, Java, Chestnut Grove, Richburg and Victoria. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
